qas.question: When did the Italians bomb Barcelona?
Why was club Barcelona placed under restrictions during the occupation?
What kind of signs were removed form club Barcelona?
What flag was removed from the club's crest?
What new named was the Barcelona club forced to adopt?

context: On <a0_0>16 March 1938<a0_0/>, Barcelona came under aerial bombardment from the Italian Air Force, causing more than 3,000 deaths, with one of the bombs hitting the club's offices. A few months later, Catalonia came under occupation and as a symbol of the <a1_0>"undisciplined" Catalanism<a1_0/>, the club, now down to just 3,486 members, faced a number of restrictions. All signs of <a2_0>regional nationalism<a2_0/>, including language, flag and other signs of separatism were banned throughout Spain. The Catalan flag was banned and the club were prohibited from using non-Spanish names. These measures forced the club to change its name to <a4_0>Club de Fútbol Barcelona<a4_0/> and to remove the <a3_0>Catalan<a3_0/> flag from its crest.
